intro: Ardisia paschalis, commonly known as the Christmas berry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, bright red berries that appear during the holiday season. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded forest understorey environments. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
